#Text=Recognize a Good School for Your Ward 's Admission
#Text=Many parents rushed and admitted their ward(s) in most schools because of their packages presented during sensitisation .
#Text=Mostly , the name of the school can be influential in the selection of the best Nursery School .
#Text=When once the name of the school is an English type ending with either school or international ; then may influenced the choice of any parent coming around the school for inquiry .
#Text=Outside this , some schools may be attracted to rich parents when the tuition fee is of the high tone .
#Text=If your school is low fee , you will attract low estate parents ( average parents ) .
#Text=The following are the steps to make proper decision when admitting your ward(s) :
#Text=Steps

#Text=When you receive any information from a particular school through printing flyer , flex banner , radio jingle , television announcement , newspaper advert , website announcement , social media , verbal communication , sms , or phone call , First , read or listen carefully to get more details about the school .
#Text=Note their phone number , email address , website address , school contact address , administrator or contact person and put it down on a piece of paper for your verification .
#Text=Pray for the true vision , prepare and visit the school on your own spare time .
#Text=Do not inform them that you are coming .
#Text=Surprise them with a visit .
#Text=Do not drive down there if you have a car , but take a commercial vehicle and walk down to the school .
#Text=You did this so as to know how they receive a rich and an average man .
#Text=Tell who ever is in charge to walk you around to see the facilities they have in place .
#Text=Ask of restroom , canteen , playground , safety gargets , entrance and exist doors , Monster point , Library , etc.
#Text=This is to enable you know how they have prepared to handle your kid(s) for you .
#Text=Knowing that , school is a home away home .
#Text=Ask the school administrator if there is any insurance scheme governing the children in case of any incident in the school or at home .
#Text=The typical example for school that has arranged for the insurance scheme for pupils can be seen on their flyers .
#Text=Ask the head of teachers the qualification of the employed teachers and custodians .
#Text=The learning process of your child matters a lot , therefore , qualification and experience are required in this part .
#Text=If possible , demand to see the CV ( Curriculum Vitae ) of the teacher who may happen to handle your kid in learning .
#Text=Reason is that , most schools framed around telling people that they have qualified and experienced teachers just to get you admit your child , meanwhile they have none .
#Text=Most schools employed SSCE ( school leavers ) to teach , which is not good for educational sector .
#Text=Ask them the admission process .
#Text=If their admission into the school is just to obtain a form and pay fee , do n't enroll your ward .
#Text=A standard school will first receive you , give you a refreshing juice and before issuing admission form .
#Text=The form is not a gateway to your admission , rather a step for entrance examination .
#Text=After submission of the form , entrance exams shall be conducted upon the scheduled date .
#Text=This exam is to access the child capability in the intended class and help for recommendation
#Text=Require to know the tuition fee .
#Text=Do n't be discouraged if the tuition is lower than your expectation .
#Text=Most school can be high fee but no standard of teaching .
#Text=Most school with low tuition fee employed qualified and experienced and updated teacher .
#Text=If your ward pass exams , rush and make payment .
#Text=But before that , make sure you are briefed on the payment method .
#Text=If the school has a corporate account , demand to know account name and number .
#Text=Special subjects are necessary to make enquiry if the school offers : Computer French
#Text=Creative arts Music Mathematics English Igbo etc
#Text=Warnings
#Text=This steps is free in wikiHow
